name: places/ChIJK_YJm15YwokRv1AR-lkTik0
formattedAddress: 232 W 61st St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 232 W 61st St, New York, NY 10023-7803, USA

originalText.text:
A super cute pediatric dentist's office. The office is very bright and cheerful and very welcoming for little ones. The waiting space is very clean, has a bunch of books and toys as well as iPads to keep kids of all ages occupied. There's also a little nook to park strollers in.

Another awesome touch is that the 3 "O"s in their logo at the entrance are interconnected gears and my 3yo loves turning them round and round forever.

Finally, let's talk about the most important aspect of a dentist's office -- the dentists themselves. I've been taking my daughter here twice a year since she was an year old, and have seen 2 of the dentists. I've found them to be extremely knowledgeable and professional. They have given us very good age-appropriate advice on every visit, and make themselves available for follow-up consultation, q&a, etc, over email if needed. I continue to be a lazy dad, and only follow about 50% of their advice, but I feel like that still helped get us into a really good routine with our child's dental care.

Great job, guys! Now, if you could juuuuust figure out a way of making me shed my laziness and follow your advice 100% of the time, I'd give you 6 stars!

originalText.text:
Had the best experience for my son's first dentist appointment. I felt really bad because I was stuck in a meeting during the beginning of the appointment, but the staff and Dr. Mallory Marquie were very understanding and accommodating. I didn't know what to expect because I've never been to a pediatric dental appointment before, but I'm so glad I chose to come here!

I was impressed by the way she engaged conversation with my 8 month old son -- basically an all-in-one dentist and preschool teacher. I was also impressed by the way she engaged with me as well -- she asked me a lot of questions about my son and provided me with tips and information about what to expect in regards to his dental development and addressing any at-home behaviors that may be detrimental to his dental health. She even gave my son a little toy for him to take home.

My only complaint is the appointment time -- it seems that their availability isn't that flexible hence having to schedule an appointment during my core work hours. However, that isn't really a dealbreaker for me.

Looks like I found a permanent pediatric dentist for my son!

originalText.text: Dr. Vanessa is everything you want in a pediatric dentist. She is knowledgeable, compassionate, and kind to my special needs child. Her entire staff are very pleasant to work with.We moved to NYC recently from Long Island where my son Alex had his dentist for the past 12 years. Dr. Vanessa came highly recommended from my sons school and from the first interaction I could tell that she was the master of the art of making children feel calm. I recommend her and her staff highly to anyone who is in need of a pediatric dentist.

originalText.text: My son has been a patient here since he was just under 2 years old and is 8 now.  He absolutely LOVES going to the dentist!  Both Dr. Sejal and Dr. Vanessa and super friendly with both parents and children, knowledgeable and work very quickly to keep all appointments on time.  Highly recommend this practice - they take the time to explain all issues and teach children how to practice good dental hygiene from an early age.

originalText.text:
Be very careful,
I took my five year old and am very disappointed in how the billing and treatment plan was managed. They put you through treatment and never advised on what would or wouldn’t be covered - given my experience with my own dentist you would assume a filling is covered! By the time you leave you get a $500 bill, told they will claim and then refund, but they don’t give you a penny back! i had to chase them three times and the front desk is like a circus - they have no clue what they are doing.

ask them bluntly is it covered!!!!
